text:
With party leaders often making a single in-person campaign stop each day due to COVID-19, where they choose to go could say a lot about party strategies. Here, we’ve mapped every appearance made by the leaders.

Scroll down
John Horgan has focused on Metro ridings his NDP would like to flip. Andrew Wilkinson has concentrated on Metro seats his Liberals need to keep.
Green leader Sonia Furstenau has focused her campaign around Victoria and her base in the Cowichan Valley, with trips to Vancouver, Squamish and Whistler.
Both Horgan and Wilkinson have traveled north to Kitimat and east to the Kootenays and the interior...
... but these were some of their only stops outside of the vote-rich Lower Mainland.
